document.masterDocTitle: Spiders of the genus Phycosoma O. P. - Cambridge, 1879 (Araneae: Theridiidae) from Hainan Island, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Spiders of the genus Phycosoma O. P. - Cambridge, 1879 (Araneae: Theridiidae) from Hainan Island, China

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dipoena stellaris
Zhu, 1998
: 230
, f. 149 A – D;
Song, Zhu & Chen, 1999
: 112
, f. 56 G – H.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype
Ƥ,
CHINA , Hainan Island :
Qionghai County ( 19 °00ʹN, 109 °08ʹE),
5 August 1990
, M. B. Gu leg., deposited in MHBU , examined.

Other material examined. CHINA , Hainan Island :
1 3, 3 Ƥ, Jianfengling Mountain,
2 June 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; 1 3, 1 Ƥ, Diaoluo Mountain,
6 June 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; 1 Ƥ, Wuzhishan City ( 18 ° 39 ʹN, 109 ° 19 ʹE),
8 November 2008
, G. X. Han leg.; 1 3 , Qixianling Mountain ( 18 ° 14 ʹN, 109 ° 37 ʹE), Baoting County,
8 June 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; 1 Ƥ, Xichang Town ( 19 ° 10 ʹN, 109 ° 53 ʹE), Tunchang County,
11 June 2009
, C. Zhang leg.; 1 Ƥ, Huangzhu Town ( 19 ° 32 ʹN, 110 ° 24 ʹE), Ding’an County,
22 November 2008
, G. X. Han leg.

Diagnosis. Males can be distinguished from other
Phycosoma
species except
P. nigromaculatum (Yoshida, 1987 )
by the wholly sclerotized dorsum of the opisthosoma. It differs from
P. nigromaculatum
in conductor and embolus positioning (
Figs
9 – 11
). Females can be distinguished from all other
Phycosoma
species except P. m a r t i - nae (
Roberts, 1983
) by the small scapus extending slightly beyond the epigastric furrow. It is separated from
P. martinae
by the oval first seminal receptacle (
Figs
13 – 14
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9–14.
Phycosoma stellaris (Zhu, 1998)
9–11, male holotype. 9, body, dorsal; 10, male left palp, ventral; 11, same, prolateral; 12–14, female paratype. 12, opisthosoma of female, dorsal; 13, epigynum, ventral; 13, vulva, dorsal. Scale bars: 9, 12, 0.5 mm; 10–11, 13–14, 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription. Male (Jianfengling Mountain) total length 1.58 : prosoma 0.70 long, 0.53 wide, 0.31 high; opisthosoma 0.90 long, 0.65 wide. Size range: Male total body length
1.54 – 1.58
(n= 3 ).

Male palp (
Figs
10 – 11
). Tegulum slightly inflated; embolus short and pointed in ventral view; conductor small and C-shaped in prolateral view.

Female (Jianfengling Mountain). Total length 2.02 : prosoma 0.63 long, 0.63 wide, 0.45 high; opisthosoma 1.44 long, 1.04 wide.Size range: Female total body length
1.98 – 2.02
(n= 8 ).

Prosoma. Both eye rows recurved in dorsal view. Eye measurements: AME 0.10 , ALE 0.08 , PME 0.08 , PLE 0.08 ; AME – AME 0.09 , AME – ALE 0.02 , ALE – ALE 0.36 , PME – PME 0.08 , PME – PLE 0.09 , PLE – PLE 0.39 , ALE and PLE contiguous. MOA 0.18 long, anterior width 0.26 , posterior width 0.18 . Clypeus 0.27 a few. Labium 0.09 long, 0.14 wide. Sternum 0.41 long, 0.36 wide.
Opisthosoma. The characters identical to holotype .

Female genitalia (
Figs
13 – 14
). Epigynum slightly sclerotized, posterior part with a small epigynal atrium, copulatory openings concealed within atrium; second seminal receptacle globose and first seminal receptacle oval; copulatory ducts long and bent.

Comments. While examining specimens from Hainan Island we found two samples where males were captured together with females, the color pattern and setae arrangement of both sexes are the same except the more sclerotized dorsum of the male opisthosoma. As the females are
P. stellaris
, the males can reasonably be expected to be conspecific. The male is described here for the first time.
